ygData.subject: Re: MindTouch Dream
ygData.msgSnippet: ... It doesn t.  According to [1] (section 3.3), the @ character is legal in the URI path and does not require escaping. Cheers, - Steve [1]

Mike Schinkel wrote:
> > Ah yes, the ugly '@' prefix. It's to avoid naming =
clashes between
> > built-in and custom URIs. 
> 
> I definitely wouldn't u=
se something that requires encoding.

It doesn't.  According to [1] (sectio=
n 3.3), the '@' character is
legal in the URI path and does not require esc=
aping.


Cheers,

- Steve

[1] http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt
